definition[0]: to express feelings of great sadness about something
example[0]: The nation lamented the death of its great war leader.
definition[1]: to express annoyance or disappointment about something you think is unsatisfactory or unfair
example[1]: Steiner lamented the lack of public interest in the issue.
note[0]: lament the lack/absence/decline etc of something
example[2]: He lamented that people had expected too much of him too soon.
example[3]: She lamented the fact that manufacturers did not produce small packs for single-person households.
definition[2]: a song, piece of music, or something that you say, that expresses a feeling of sadness
example[4]: A lone piper played a lament.
